examples: With an accurate throw , he lassoed the cow.
What a great throw by the quarterback!
The gambler staked everything on one throw of the dice.

definitions.definition: ( martial arts ) A move in which one lifts or unbalances one’s opponent and then brings him down to the ground .

examples: He’s always had a pretty decent throw .

definitions.definition: The distance travelled by something thrown.
( Can we verify this sense?) The flight of a thrown object.
A distance travelled in general; displacement .
A piece of fabric used to cover a bed, sofa or other soft furnishing.
( informal ) A single instance , occurrence , venture , or chance .
examples: Football tickets are expensive at fifty bucks a throw .

definitions.definition: Any of the projections integral to a crankshaft that receive or impart cranking motion from a connecting rod or similar component.
( historical ) A hand-operated lathe , especially a small lathe used by clockmakers .

secondary_definitions: ( martial arts ) A move in which one lifts or unbalances one’s opponent and then brings him down to the ground .
The distance travelled by something thrown.
( Can we verify this sense?) The flight of a thrown object.
A distance travelled in general; displacement .
A piece of fabric used to cover a bed, sofa or other soft furnishing.
( informal ) A single instance , occurrence , venture , or chance .
Any of the projections integral to a crankshaft that receive or impart cranking motion from a connecting rod or similar component.
( historical ) A hand-operated lathe , especially a small lathe used by clockmakers .

definitions.definition: ( obsolete ) A period of time; a while .

secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) A period of time; a while .
